column4: how can i change the default grud list i want that it starts windows after 10 secs
can someone help me how i can change the grud list
Add something like GRUB_DEFAULT="Windows Vista (loader) (on /dev/sda4)" to /etc/default/grub, change the timeout to what you want in the same file, then run "sudo update-grub".
You'll need to get the exact title for your windows entry from your /boot/grub/grub.cfg
You deleted the windows boot partition (also called the "system" partititon) or Ubuntu's?
Can you run boot info script as explained here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and pastebin the RESULTS.txt?
Can you boot from a LiveCD?
Can you boot a liveCD and run boot info script as explained here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and pastebin the RESULTS.txt?
Can you boot a liveCD and run boot info script as explained here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and pastebin the RESULTS.txt?
I cannot help you untill you gprovide the information I have asked for 3 times.

What exactly did you put on a USB drive?
or do i need the unetbootin
Do you have anything you can use to boot a linux system, i.e. a liveCD or liveUSB ?
Then run boot info script as explained here http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 then pastebin the RESULTS.txt.
If there are any step on that page that you do not understand please state specifically which it is.
If you can already boot the machine in question and "Try Ubuntu" then you do not need unetbootin at all.
